t: Isaiah 42
The Lord’s Chosen Servant
Behold*pn my servant, whom I uphold, my*ld chosen, in whom my soul delights; I*ln have put my Spirit upon him; he*ld will bring forth justice to the nations.
He*ln will not cry aloud or lift up his voice, or*ld make it heard in the street;
a*ln bruised reed he will not break, and*ld a faintly burning wick he will not quench; he*ld will faithfully bring forth justice.
He*ln will not grow faint or be discouraged till*ld he has established justice in the earth; and*ld the coastlands wait for his law.

Thus*pn says God, the Lord,*s who*ld created the heavens and stretched them out, who*ld spread out the earth and what comes from it, who*ln gives breath to the people on it and*ld spirit to those who walk in it:
“I*ln am the Lord;*s I have called you in righteousness; I*ld will take you by the hand and keep you; I*ln will give you as a covenant for the people, a*ld light for the nations,
to*ld open the eyes that are blind, to*ln bring out the prisoners from the dungeon, from*ld the prison those who sit in darkness.
I*ln am the Lord;*s that is my name; my*ld glory I give to no other, nor*ld my praise to carved idols.
Behold,*ln the former things have come to pass, and*ld new things I now declare; before*ln they spring forth I*ld tell you of them.”
Sing to the Lord a New Song
Sing*pn to the Lord*s a new song, his*ld praise from the end of the earth, you*ln who go down to the sea, and all that fills it, the*ld coastlands and their inhabitants.
Let*ln the desert and its cities lift up their voice, the*ld villages that Kedar inhabits; let*ln the habitants of Sela sing for joy, let*ld them shout from the top of the mountains.
Let*ln them give glory to the Lord,*s and*ld declare his praise in the coastlands.
The*ln Lord*s goes out like a mighty man, like*ld a man of war he stirs up his zeal; he*ln cries out, he shouts aloud, he*ld shows himself mighty against his foes.
For*pn a long time I have held my peace; I*ld have kept still and restrained myself; now*ln I will cry out like a woman in labor; I*ld will gasp and pant.
I*ln will lay waste mountains and hills, and*ld dry up all their vegetation; I*ln will turn the rivers into islands, and*ld dry up the pools.

And*ln I will lead the blind in*ld a way that they do not know, in*ln paths that they have not known I*ld will guide them. I*ln will turn the darkness before them into light, the*ld rough places into level ground. These*ln are the things I do, and*ld I do not forsake them.
They*ln are turned back and utterly put to shame, who*ld trust in carved idols, who*ln say to metal images, “You*ld are our gods.”
Israel’s Failure to Hear and See
Hear,*pn you deaf, and*ld look, you blind, that you may see!
Who*ln is blind but my servant, or*ld deaf as my messenger whom I send? Who*ln is blind as my dedicated one, or*ld blind as the servant of the Lord?*s
He*ln sees many things, but does not observe them; his*ld ears are open, but he does not hear.
The*ln Lord*s was pleased, for his righteousness’ sake, to*ld magnify his law and make it glorious.
But*ln this is a people plundered and looted; they*ld are all of them trapped in holes and*ld hidden in prisons; they*ln have become plunder with none to rescue, spoil*ld with none to say, “Restore!”
Who*ln among you will give ear to this, will*ld attend and listen for the time to come?
Who*ln gave up Jacob to the looter, and*ld Israel to the plunderers? Was*ln it not the Lord,*s against whom we have sinned, in*ld whose ways they would not walk, and*ld whose law they would not obey?
So*ln he poured on him the heat of his anger and*ld the might of battle; it*ln set him on fire all around, but he did not understand; it*ld burned him up, but he did not take it to heart.
